0.name: Preamble
0.description: New Caledonia is the nation of the future, for the future, by the future. New Caledonia strives to be a pretty freaking cool place. Everyone has rights, and it is the job of our government to protect these rights. The government is not perfect and not everyone gets along, but its these hardships that break us that also pulls us together.

1.name: Article 1 (Powers Act)
1.description:
The Council and Senate make up the executive and legislative bodies respectively.
Council Powers:
The election is held every 4 months between the senate elections
The power to vote in laws: Majority needed for laws, all needed for amendments. All councilmen must be given at least a day to see the proposed law and voice their opinion
Councilmen may elect deputy councilmen to take over their position in cases which they cannot
Councilmen can see discussions made by senators, but are not allowed to participate or attempt to influence members thoughts
Majority councilmen can prevent a senator's ability to run in the next election with reason. They cannot use digressions in a different term, nor can they reuse digressions within a term
Senate Powers:
The election is held every 4 months between the council elections
The senate will have someone representing each borough and province, those representatives cannot be councilmen, but are permitted to be deputy councilmen
Senators may elect their own deputies in cases where they either can’t do their job, or are needed as deputy councilmen to take over for the councilmen
Majority senate can prevent a councilman's ability to run in the next election with reason. They cannot use digressions in a different term, nor can they reuse digressions within a term
Shared Powers:
Both groups will be the first potential judges in cases
A majority senate vote can veto laws while a full council vote can cancel vetoes
At least one CST and JST vote is needed to veto laws. In cases where the senate does not consist of both groups, an citizen of the party with no representation can be used, with exceptions to provincial rulers and councilmen
Banned citizens cannot hold either position
⅓ of the senators can start an approval vote on a councilman at least 4 weeks after the councilmen take office. Citizens of the resulting boroughs can start an approval poll on a senator representing a borough 4 weeks after the senators take office. Provinces may choose how to do their approval votes if they choose to have them. No campaigning is allowed during an approval vote
If either group wishes to run for the opposing seat, they may, but at the cost of their previous seat.

3.name: Article 3
3.description: Don’t kill people, that's not nice. Don’t rob people, that's not nice. Don’t trespass, that's not nice.

5.name: Article 5
5.description: The Music Bot has to be at 5% volume or less at all times

5.1.name: Article 5 - Amendment 1
5.1.description: Those who kill eardrums without consent receive a minimum of 2 days in prison.

6.name: Article 6
6.description: Yelling, constantly talking too much, or repeating the same thing over and over again is not permitted if so you will be banned from the chat.

7.name: Article 7
7.description: The Enforcers and The Enforcer Captain must follow the [Enforcer Code of Conduct.](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ntRTmBb5t_9-FpVyBRJvn4sJ3rOcMUbseCPgQG1vi6E/edit)

8.name: Article 8
8.description: No cruel and unusual punishment will be enacted. If exile is necessary, it will be for a maximum of 7 Minecraft days. Any additional sentences will be gradually added as seen fit by the government. Under no circumstances will the accused be kicked from the game. That's not cool.

8.1.name: Article 8 - Amendment 1
8.1.description: A long term and/or indefinite ban can be enacted if the entire innocent Council deems it necessary.

9.name: Article 9
9.description: Gambling is legalized, and will follow Vegas rules (i.e. You cheat, you die).

10.name: Article 10
10.description: Villagers of New Llanfairpwllgwyngyllgogerychwyrndrobwllllantysiliogogogoch hold the same status as any autonomous citizen of New Caledonia.
